p: A particularly promising approach is ZFN-mediated gene knockout directly in early embryos, because it offers a one-step method without any cell intermediate, as shown for zebrafish [18], [19], rats [20], [21] and mice [22]. Most recently, ZFN-mediated gene targeting by homologous recombination has been achieved in mice and rats [23], [24]. However ZFNs are likely to make their greatest impact in species where classical means of gene targeting are not available. Here we demonstrate that ZFNs enable precise genetic engineering in a particularly intractable species.
